text: When the Canaanite king of Arad who lived in the Negev heard that Israel was approaching along the road to Atharim, he fought against Israel and took some of them prisoner.
So Israel made a vow to the Lord and said, “If you will indeed deliver this people into our hand, then we will utterly destroy their cities.”
The Lord listened to the voice of Israel and delivered up the Canaanites, and they utterly destroyed them and their cities. So the name of the place was called Hormah.
Then they traveled from Mount Hor by the road to the Red Sea, to go around the land of Edom, but the people became impatient along the way.
And the people spoke against God and against Moses, “Why have you brought us up from Egypt to die in the wilderness, for there is no bread or water, and we detest this worthless food.”
So the Lord sent venomous snakes among the people, and they bit the people; many people of Israel died.

Then the people came to Moses and said, “We have sinned, for we have spoken against the Lord and against you. Pray to the Lord that he would take away the snakes from us.” So Moses prayed for the people.
The Lord said to Moses, “Make a poisonous snake and set it on a pole. When anyone who is bitten looks at it, he will live.”
So Moses made a bronze snake and put it on a pole, so that if a snake had bitten someone, when he looked at the bronze snake he lived.
The Israelites traveled on and camped in Oboth.

Then they <st data-num="05265" class="">traveled on</st> from <st data-num="088" class="">Oboth</st> and <st data-num="02583" class="">camped</st> at <st data-num="05863" class="">Iye Abarim</st>,<n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> is <st data-num="05921 06440">before</st> <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st> on the <st data-num="04217 08121">eastern side</st>.<n id="2" />

From <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> they <st data-num="05265" class="">moved on</st> and <st data-num="02583" class="">camped</st> in the <st data-num="05158" class="">valley</st> of <st data-num="02218" class="">Zered</st>.

From <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> they <st data-num="05265" class="">moved on</st> and <st data-num="02583" class="">camped</st> on the <st data-num="05676" class="">other side</st> of the <st data-num="0769" class="">Arnon</st>, in the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> that <st data-num="03318" class="">extends</st> from the <st data-num="01366" class="">regions</st><n id="1" /> of the <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorites</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="0769" class="">Arnon</st> is the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st>, <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st> and the <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorites</st>.

This is why it is said in the Book of the Wars of the Lord,

“Waheb in Suphah and the wadis,

the Arnon

and the slope of the valleys

that extends to the dwelling of Ar,

and falls off at the border of Moab.”
And from there they traveled to Beer; that is the well where the Lord spoke to Moses, “Gather the people and I will give them water.”

Then Israel sang this song:

“Spring up, O well, sing to it!

The well which the princes dug,

which the leaders of the people opened

with their scepters and their staffs.”

And from the wilderness they traveled to Mattanah;
and from <st data-num="04980" class="">Mattanah</st> to <st data-num="05160" class="">Nahaliel</st>; and from <st data-num="05160" class="">Nahaliel</st> to <st data-num="01120" class="">Bamoth</st>;
and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the country of Moab, near the top of Pisgah, which overlooks the wastelands.
Then Israel sent messengers to King Sihon of the Amorites, saying,

“Let us pass through your land; we will not turn aside into the fields or into the vineyards, nor will we drink water from any well, but we will go along the King’s Highway until we pass your borders.”

But <st data-num="05511" class="">Sihon</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">permit</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> to <st data-num="05674" class="">pass through</st> his <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st>; <st data-num="05511" class="">he</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0622" class="">gathered</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="05971" class="">forces</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0622" class="">together</st> and <st data-num="03318" class="">went out</st> <st data-num="07125" class="">against</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> into the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st>. When<n id="3" /> he <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> to <st data-num="03096" class="">Jahaz</st>, he <st data-num="03898" class="">fought</st> against <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.

But the <st data-num="03478" class="">Israelites</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05221" class="">defeated</st> him <st data-num="06310 02719">in battle</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03423" class="">took possession</st> of his <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> from the <st data-num="0769" class="">Arnon</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="02999" class="">Jabbok</st>, <st data-num="05704" class="">as far as</st> the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st> was <st data-num="05794" class="">strongly defended</st>.

So <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st>; and <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">settled</st> in <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of the <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorites</st>, in <st data-num="02809" class="">Heshbon</st>, and in <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> its <st data-num="01323" class="">villages</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> <st data-num="02809" class="">Heshbon</st> was the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05511" class="">Sihon</st> of the <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorites</st>. Now <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> had <st data-num="03898" class="">fought</st> against the <st data-num="07223" class="">former</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st> and had <st data-num="03947" class="">taken</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> from his <st data-num="03027" class="">control</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05704" class="">as far as</st> the <st data-num="0769" class="">Arnon</st>.

That is why those who speak in proverbs say,

“Come to Heshbon, let it be built.

Let the city of Sihon be established!

For fire went out from Heshbon,

a flame from the city of Sihon.

It has consumed Ar of Moab

and the lords of the high places of Arnon.

Woe to you, Moab.

You are ruined, O people of Chemosh!

He has made his sons fugitives,

and his daughters the prisoners of King Sihon of the Amorites.

We have overpowered them;

Heshbon has perished as far as Dibon.

We have shattered them as far as Nophah,

which reaches to Medeba.”
So the Israelites lived in the land of the Amorites.
Moses sent spies to reconnoiter Jazer, and they captured its villages and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.
Then they turned and went up by the road to Bashan. And King Og of Bashan and all his forces marched out against them to do battle at Edrei.

And the Lord said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I have delivered him and all his people and his land into your hand. You will do to him what you did to King Sihon of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.”
So they defeated Og, his sons, and all his people, until there were no survivors, and they possessed his land.
